DataElement.preferredName: Patient No During Surgical Procedure Randomization Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the reason for the lack of intra-operative randomization, the allocation of individuals to groups by chance during a surgical procedure, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment, for a patient/participant.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient No During Surgical Procedure Randomization
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the lack of intra-operative randomization, the allocation of individuals to groups by chance during a surgical procedure, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment, for a patient/participant.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:At some point in a given period of time.:Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.:The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
At some point in a given period of time.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.
